abstract.t: This document specifies a new TCP option - the TCP User Timeout Option - that allows a TCP to advertise its current user timeout for a connection. Thus, the remote TCP may modify its local user timeout based on knowledge of the peer's user timeout. The TCP user timeout controls how long transmitted data may remain unacknowledged before a connection is forcefully closed. It is a local, per-connection parameter.
